title: 108_hr4936
content: The Act may be cited as the "Children's Health Protection and Improvement Act of 2004". Changes are made to rules for redistribution and extended availability of 1998 through 2004 SCHIP allotments. Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act is amended to extend deadlines for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004 SCHIP allotments. Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act is amended to extend deadlines for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004 SCHIP allotments by adjusting specified amounts. The amendment to Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act extends deadlines for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004 SCHIP allotments by adjusting specified amounts. The amendment to Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004 by modifying specified amounts. The amendment to Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004 by modifying specified amounts. It includes provisions for the availability of funds for expenditure by the State through the end of fiscal year 2006. The amendment to Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. Funds for fiscal year 2003 remain available for State expenditure through fiscal year 2007, while fiscal year 2004 follows subsection (e). Amounts used in redistributions for fiscal year 2002 are specified with adjustments. The amendment to Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. The amount specified for a State is the excess of its expenditures under this title in those years over its allotment for fiscal year 2002. The sum of these amounts for all States entitled to redistribution is used in computing redistributions for fiscal year 2003. The amendment adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. The amount specified for a State is the excess of its expenditures under this title in those years over its allotment for fiscal year 2002. The amendment adjusts SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2002, 2003, and 2004. The sum for all States entitled to redistribution is calculated based on specified amounts. Expenditures in fiscal years 2004, 2005, and 2006 exceed State's allotment for fiscal year 2004. Amendments adjust SCHIP allotments for specified years. Amendments adjust SCHIP allotments for specified years, including the fiscal year 2002 allotment remaining available for expenditure by the State. Amendments adjust SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 2003 and 2004, allowing states to spend remaining amounts through fiscal years 2007 and 2006 respectively. Amendments extend availability of SCHIP allotments for fiscal years 1998 through 2002, allowing states to spend remaining amounts through specified years. Amendments allow states to extend the availability of SCHIP funds for fiscal years 1998-2000. If funds were not spent by the end of fiscal year 2004, 30% remains available for expenditure until 2007, with the remainder redistributed to states that have fully expended their 2002 allotments. Allotments under this section for fiscal year 2002 are redistributed to states in the same ratio as unexpended funds from that year. Amounts redistributed shall be available for expenditure until the end of fiscal year 2007. For fiscal year 2001 allotments not expended by the end of fiscal year 2005, specific rules apply. The rules for redistributing unexpended funds from fiscal years 2001 and 2002 are outlined. 30 percent of the funds from fiscal year 2001 remain available for state expenditure until the end of fiscal year 2007. The remaining funds are redistributed to states that have fully expended their fiscal year 2003 allotments. These redistributed funds are also available for expenditure until the end of fiscal year 2007. For fiscal year 2002 funds not expended by states, 30% remains available for expenditure until the end of fiscal year 2007. The rest is redistributed to states that fully spent their fiscal year 2004 allotments. For fiscal year 2002 funds not spent by states, 30% remains available for expenditure until the end of fiscal year 2007. The remaining amount is redistributed to states that fully utilized their fiscal year 2004 allotments in the same ratio. Continued authority for qualifying states to use certain funds for Medicaid expenditures is extended to include fiscal years 2001, 2002, 2003, or 2004.
